intro: Ibarraea leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited ibarraea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, white seeds. Ibarraea leucocarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats at high altitudes.
